action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the side table, the plate on the shelf and the mop in the freezer.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a chair and a shelf. There are passages to a hallway, a bedroom and a kitchen here.
> look at shelf
Turn 1
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
> examine shelf
Turn 2
There is nothing on the shelf.
> go to kitchen
Turn 3
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a pantry and a living room here.
> open cupboard
Turn 4
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
> take plate
Turn 5
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
> go to pantry
Turn 6
You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer, a refrigerator and a table. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
> open freezer
Turn 7
The freezer is now open. The freezer is empty.
> go to living room
Turn 8
You can't go to a living room from here.
> go to kitchen
Turn 9

> take book

> drop book

> put book on bed
